intro: Gilia aggregata subsp. bridgesii, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss. Gilia aggregata subsp. bridgesii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
